availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Aug 15 1864
Commonwealth of Kentucky
To any Constable of Henry County.

You are commanded to summon Wyatt I Morias and Emmit Bashaw. of Said County to appear before me or some Magistrate of said County so appear be to answer the charge of committing a breach of the Peace in the town of New Castle on saturday night last by drunken disorderly conduct. and otherwise on that occasion, the day before and since disturbing the peace of good Citizens by drunkeness swearing &c. Aug 15 1864

"We of the jury agree that the defendants W I Morias & Emmet Bashaw are each guilty of the charges alledged. and that they shall be confined in the county jail for fifteen days and pay costs. W A Holland foreman"
Whereupon the said defendants were convicted in the following order towit
To the Jailor of Henry County

I herewith send you the order of W I Morias and Emmet Bashaw of said County brought before me on charge of having committed a breach of the Peace, and you the said jailor, are hereby commanded. to receive them into your jail and custody there to remain for the space of fifteen days unless released. by due process of law
Wm A Perry J P H C"
The foregoing is a true Copy of the records in my office in the Case of the Commonwealth of Ky vs W J Morias and Emmett Bashaw on 15th Aug 1864

Wm A Perry J. P. H. C
Aug 22nd 1864
